response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "Being 21 years old indicates immaturity and increased likelihood of impulsive behaviors."],
    ["Gender", "high", "Male gender is statistically associated with higher rates of recidivism."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Having been arrested twice with convictions significantly increases the risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "high", "Recent use of marijuana and cocaine is a strong risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Marital and Living Status", "medium", "Never married and living alone can indicate less social support, moderately increasing risk."],
    ["Education", "medium", "Holding only a high school diploma and not pursuing further education is associated with limited opportunities."],
    ["Employment", "medium", "Having held three jobs in a year suggests employment instability, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household with five members may reflect exposure to higher-risk environments."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Belief in a divine influence may serve as a protective factor, reducing risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being 21 years old indicates immaturity and increased likelihood of impulsive behaviors.
Male gender is statistically associated with higher rates of recidivism.
Having been arrested twice with convictions significantly increases the risk.
Recent use of marijuana and cocaine is a strong risk factor for recidivism.
Never married and living alone can indicate less social support, moderately increasing risk.
Holding only a high school diploma and not pursuing further education is associated with limited opportunities.
Having held three jobs in a year suggests employment instability, contributing moderately to risk.
Growing up in an urban household with five members may reflect exposure to higher-risk environments.
Belief in a divine influence may serve as a protective factor, reducing risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 2 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 4 inches and weighs 190 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
